item.title: Blackstone 据称酝酿对 AirTrunk 次级债务进行再融资
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 计划为拟收购 AirTrunk Pte.Ltd.的次级债进行再融资，这是这家另类资产管理公司在亚太地区有史以来最大的一笔投资。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is planning to refinance an around A$5.5 billion ($3.6 billion) of junior debt it is raising for the proposed buyout of AirTrunk Pte. Ltd., in what is the alternative asset manager’s largest-ever investment in Asia Pacific.】

item.title: 特朗普赢得美国大选引发印度 IT 股意外反弹
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 特朗普获胜让莫迪有机会重塑印度在西方的形象
item.description: 在亚洲，很少有领导人比印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪更高兴看到唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫。【原文：Few leaders in Asia are more happy to see Donald Trump heading back to the White House than Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.】

item.title: 加州批准 100 亿美元债券用于改善学校：美联社
item.description: 加州投票通过了一项为 K-12 学校和社区学院发行 100 亿美元债券的议案，这反映出在入学率下降和教师短缺日益严重的情况下，州政府再次承诺改善教育基础设施。【原文：A California ballot measure to authorize $10 billion in bonds for K-12 schools and community colleges passed, reflecting a renewed commitment to improving the state’s educational infrastructure amid declining enrollment and a growing teacher shortage.】

item.title: 菲律宾第三季度经济增速放缓至 5.2
item.description: 菲律宾第三季度的经济增长速度低于市场预期，为中央银行进一步降息提供了新的动力。【原文：The Philippine economy grew slower than market expectations in the third quarter, giving the central bank fresh impetus to further cut interest rates.】

item.title: 韩国尹炳世与特朗普通话引发造船股飙升
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示希望与亚洲国家密切合作之后，韩国造船业股票周四逆市上扬。【原文：South Korean shipbuilding stocks advanced Thursday, defying declines in the broader market, after Donald Trump expressed hopes for close cooperation with the Asian nation.】

item.title: 中国将人民币定盘价设定为 2023 年以来最弱，为人民币贬值开绿灯
item.description: 中国将其货币每日参考汇率降至 2023 年底以来的最低水平，这表明在美元飙升重创人民币之后，中国央行正在允许人民币贬值。【原文：China slashed the daily reference rate for its currency to a level unseen since late 2023, a sign the central bank is allowing depreciation after a surge in the dollar pummeled the yuan.】

item.title: 特朗普胜选将加剧林吉特债券 2020 年以来最大跌幅
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）即将成为下一任美国总统，当地国债收益率也将随之上升，马来西亚债券很容易受到资金进一步外流的影响。【原文：Malaysian bonds are turning vulnerable to further outflows as local yields are seen rising along with those on Treasuries with Donald Trump poised to be the next US president.】

item.title: 化学家仓库交易获批，希格玛涨至 17 年新高
item.description: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构批准了 Sigma Healthcare Ltd. 与连锁药店 Chemist Warehouse 88 亿澳元（58 亿美元）的合并案后，该公司股价飙升至 2007 年以来的最高点。【原文：Sigma Healthcare Ltd. shares surged to their highest since 2007 after Australia’s competition regulator approved the company’s A$8.8 billion ($5.8 billion) merger with pharmacy chain Chemist Warehouse.】

item.title: 澳大利亚总理表示，澳大利亚将禁止 16 岁以下儿童使用社交媒体
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴尼塞（Anthony Albanese）表示，作为保护青少年心理健康工作的一部分，澳大利亚 16 岁以下儿童将被禁止使用社交媒体，相关公司必须执行新规定，否则可能面临罚款。【原文：Children in Australia under the age of 16 will be banned from social media as part of a push to protect young people’s mental health, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said, with firms involved required to enforce the new regulations or face potential fines.】

item.title: 芯片设计公司 Graphcore 被软银收购后增员 20
item.description: 今年 7 月被软银集团收购的芯片设计公司 Graphcore 正在全球范围内增加 75 个工作岗位，将员工人数提高了 20%，这表明了母公司在半导体行业的雄心壮志。【原文：Graphcore, the chip designer acquired by SoftBank Group Corp. in July, is boosting its workforce 20% by adding 75 jobs globally, a sign of the parent company’s ambitions in the semiconductor industry.】

item.title: 高通公司、Arm 公司业绩显示手机行业卷土重来的势头并不均衡
item.description: 高通公司（Qualcomm Inc. ）和Arm Holdings Plc 这两家严重依赖智能手机市场的芯片公司周三发布的财报显示，该行业正在蹒跚起步。【原文：Qualcomm Inc. and Arm Holdings Plc, two chip companies heavily dependent on the smartphone market, delivered earnings reports Wednesday that showed an industry making a wobbly comeback.】

item.title: 交易商权衡特朗普的影响，石油在大选冲击后趋于平稳
item.description: 周三，在经历了过山车式的交易之后，石油市场趋于稳定，因为交易商们权衡了唐纳德-特朗普赢得大选可能带来的影响，以及美国原油库存的增加。【原文：Oil steadied after a roller-coaster session on Wednesday as traders weighed the likely impact of Donald Trump’s election victory, and a build in US crude inventories.】

item.title: 再次当选的特朗普能做什么，不能做什么？
item.description:
这位前任和未来的总统表示，他希望在利率问题上拥有 "发言权"— 鲍威尔不会连任主席一职。【原文：

The former and future president has said he wants a “say” on interest rates — and that Powell won’t get another term as chair.

】

item.title: 能源转让公司老板称赞特朗普获胜为油气行业带来 "新鲜空气
item.description: 管道公司 Energy Transfer LP 的联合首席执行官对唐纳德-特朗普当选美国总统表示欢迎，称他的政府将为石油和天然气行业带来 "一股新鲜空气"。【原文：The co-chief executive officer of pipeline company Energy Transfer LP welcomed the election of Donald Trump as US president, saying his administration will bring “a breath of fresh air” for the oil and gas industry.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将上涨，日元在下跌后保持稳定：市场综述
item.description: 在美国股市创下新高之后，亚洲股市周四将继续攀升，因为投资者为唐纳德-特朗普第二次当选总统做好了准备。国债下跌，美元飙升。【原文：Asian equities were set to climb Thursday after US stocks hit fresh highs as investors positioned for a second Donald Trump presidency. Treasuries tumbled and the dollar soared.】

item.title: 日本股市期货上涨，日元跌幅因特朗普获胜而扩大
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在总统竞选中获胜，引发了人们对他将推动经济增长政策以维持美国高利率的预期，隔夜日元兑美元扩大跌幅，日本股票期货上涨。【原文：Japanese stock futures rose as the yen extended losses against the dollar overnight after Donald Trump’s victory in the presidential race raised expectations he will push for economic growth policies that keep US interest rates elevated.】

item.title: 特朗普执政期间，美国证券交易委员会加密货币执法计划大幅缩水
item.description: 加密行业在总统和国会竞选中投入了数百万美元，但其最突出的选举胜利可能是美国证券交易委员会主席加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）的离职。【原文：The crypto industry poured millions of dollars into the presidential and congressional races, but its most salient election victory is likely to be the departure of US Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler.】

item.title: 台积电、GlobalFoundries 完成数十亿美元芯片奖励谈判
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，台湾半导体制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. and GlobalFoundries Inc. have finished negotiating binding agreements for billions of dollars in grants and loans to support US factories, people familiar with the matter said, as Biden administration officials race to get Chips and Science Act money out the door.】

item.title: Roblox 将禁止 13 岁以下儿童参加 "社交聚会
item.description: Roblox 公司出台了新规定，禁止 13 岁以下儿童访问仅用于社交的网络游戏，并禁止他们制作某些类型的虚拟内容，如在数字黑板上作画，这是该公司一系列儿童安全变革中的最新举措。【原文：Roblox Corp. introduced new rules preventing kids under 13 from accessing online games intended just for socializing and from making some kinds of virtual content, like drawing on digital chalkboards, the latest in a series of child-safety changes at the company.】

item.title: TikTok 因国家安全风险被勒令关闭加拿大分部
item.description: 加拿大命令 ByteDance Ltd. 清盘其子公司 TikTok Technology Canada, Inc.【原文：Canada ordered ByteDance Ltd. to wind up its subsidiary TikTok Technology Canada, Inc. — though the move will not stop Canadians from using the popular Chinese-backed social video app.】

item.title: 新西兰央行称特朗普政策带来 "更高的通胀套餐
item.description: 新西兰储备银行官员表示，随着唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫，全球央行应预见到额外的挑战。【原文：Central banks globally should anticipate extra challenges as Donald Trump returns to the White House, Reserve Bank of New Zealand officials said.】

item.title: 华润集团考虑再次出售菲律宾水泥业务
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，美国-爱尔兰建材集团 CRH Plc 正在考虑重启出售菲律宾水泥业务的计划。【原文：CRH Plc, the US-Irish building materials group, is considering reviving a sale of its Philippines cement business, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: GFL 预计将从环境服务交易中获利 43 亿美元
item.description: GFL Environmental Inc. 已收到几家买家对其环境服务业务的兴趣，预计将在今年年底前签订协议。【原文：GFL Environmental Inc. has received interest from several buyers for its environmental services business and expects to sign a deal before the end of the year.】

item.title: 美国优先 "横扫华尔街，与 2016 年的剧本遥相呼应
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）重返白宫，为其长达十年之久的投资战略增添了新的弹药，这一战略与他的 "让美国再次伟大"（Make America Great Again）口号相呼应，是对 2016 年游戏规则的重演。【原文：Donald Trump’s return to the White House is adding fresh ammo to a decade-long investment strategy that echoes his “Make America Great Again” mantra in a replay of the 2016 playbook.】

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普在纽约失利，但他正在慢慢赢得人心
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普说他能赢得纽约州。他没有赢，但他的家乡确实发生了右移，帮助他有可能赢得美国的普选。【原文：Donald Trump said he could win New York. He didn’t, but his home state did shift right — helping him potentially win the American popular vote.】

item.title: 神经链接的竞争对手精准神经科学公司融资 9,300 万美元
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的人士透露，Precision Neuroscience 公司是埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的神经链接公司（Neuralink Corp.）的大脑植入竞争对手，该公司已从计划中的一轮 1 亿美元融资中筹集到 9,300 万美元。这笔交易对这家初创公司的估值约为 5 亿美元。【原文：Precision Neuroscience Corp., a brain implant rival to Elon Musk’s Neuralink Corp., has raised $93 million of a planned $100 million funding round, according to a person familiar with the situation. The deal valued the startup at about $500 million.】

item.description: MercadoLibre 公司在整个拉丁美洲积极推进信贷业务，削弱了第三季度的利润。【原文：MercadoLibre Inc.’s aggressive push into credit across Latin America eroded profit in the third quarter.】
